comments:
hi,

I am facing problem in refreshing the workspace in Linux.
The exception thrown is attached at the end of this document.
THe resource is not readonly, I tried to manually change the file permission 
but that is also of no use.

I let me know as to why this happens. The funniest part of this is that the 
exception occurs when I am sure that the workspace is in sync with the file 
system. Is it that because i am trying to syncronise the already syncronized 
project ? 
Please help me out to resolve this problem.
 
protected IResource selectedResources[]; // Class variable

IProject ipProject = selectedResources[0].getProject();
//refresh the project to bring in the test cases created
Failed Here >>>>ipProject.refreshLocal(IResource.DEPTH_INFINITE, null);
			
IWorkbenchPage wbPage = MenuHandler.getActiveWorkbenchPage();

Exception ::

org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Errors occurred while 
refreshing resources with the local file system.
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refreshResource
(FileSystemResourceManager.java:516)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refresh
(FileSystemResourceManager.java:499)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal
(Resource.java:1151)
	at com.appperfect.plugins.eclipse.actions.AbstractLauncher.openInEditor
(AbstractLauncher.java:466)
	at com.appperfect.plugins.common.CodeAnalyzer.openFile
(CodeAnalyzer.java:537)
	at com.appperfect.devcommon.ui.swt.e.e.a(ShowEditor.java:141)
	at com.appperfect.devcommon.ui.swt.e.e.a(ShowEditor.java:65)
	at com.appperfect.devcommon.ui.swt.e.e.a(ShowEditor.java:59)
	at com.appperfect.devcommon.ui.swt.e.e.a(ShowEditor.java:46)
	at com.appperfect.codeanalyzer.a.a.a.a.a(SWTSourceFilePanel.java:54)
	at com.appperfect.codeanalyzer.a.a.a.e.a
(SWTBaseSourceFilePanel.java:336)
	at com.appperfect.common.ui.swt.d.l.if(SWTTable.java:455)
	at com.appperfect.common.ui.swt.d.l$1.handleEvent(SWTTable.java:349)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:810)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:2148)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1914)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1402)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:858)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:494)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:291)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)



Warm Regards,
Mehul Dikshit
This kind of problem should be assigned to the Platform > Resources component.

Please provide the log file entries, not just the exception(s). You can find the
log file at <workspace>/.metadata/.log. Note that if the problem happens when
you are running Eclipse from Eclipse, the workspace location is configured in
the launch configuration.

There is no .metadata folder in the workspace folder, thee are folders for the 
projects only. I am running eclipse from the console

You are not seeing it probably because on Unixes, by default, files/directories
starting with '.' are hidden. If you use "ls -la" you should see a .metadata dir
under the workspace dir. And inside it, a .log file.

I re ran the application to get the log file entries. There is nothing in the 
log file for this issue. There were some old entries only.
Note : the workspace isactually in Sync with local file system, so can thsi be 
creating some problem. Just a guess.. nothing more

Closing, not enough information.  If your code still gets the error, log the
exception when you catch it (Platform.getLog(<your bundle>).log(status)), then
give us the log file entries.  The exception will contain nested exceptions or
other status that will explain the problem in more detail.  Without this detail
we can't help you.

traces.message: Errors occurred while  refreshing resources with the local file system.
